commit.message: Removed Travis references from Doxyfile
Replaced Travis Doxygen deployment with GitHub action
Making version 2.0

Applied clang-format to all source files, plus

- Updated formatting script (apply-clang-format.sh) to process all source files
- Increased PenaltyReturnTypeOnItsOwnLine to avoid breaking long function declarations
  after the return type

Added TMCRootManager class previously provided in geant4_vmc (#15)

This allows to remove the "MTRoot" package from geant4_vmc and so
simplify building of examples and tests

Added TMCRootManager class previously provided in geant4_vmc (#15)

This allows to remove the "MTRoot" package from geant4_vmc and so
simplify building of examples and tests

tree e27947dd17c0e8d63097ad0cb75ade5a15e84bcb
parent da75642b3a1009d09acf882bda97bced6816bb51
author Ivana Hrivnacova <Ivana.Hrivnacova@cern.ch> 1643382924 +0100
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1643382924 +0100

Updated TVirtualMC interface for new features in Geant4 and clean-up: (#14)

* Extended methods for setting optical material properties
- Extended Optical surface models, types and finish type enums
  to cover all values defined in Geant4 11.0
- Extended TVirtualMC functions SetCerenkov() and SetMaterialProperty()
  to allow enabling of spline interpolation of the data and user
  properties

* Updated TMCAutoLock.h, TMCtls.h
- according to changes in Geant4 11.0

* Removed deprecated features from TVirtualMC and TVirtualMCApplication:
- Make the TVirtualMC interface function =0 and removed
  the default implementation
- Removed deprecated TVirtualMCApplication functions for MT:
  - virtual void InitForWorker() const;
  - virtual void BeginWorkerRun() const;
  - virtual void FinishWorkerRun() const;
  The non-constant functions should be used instead;
  - virtual void InitOnWorker();
  - virtual void BeginRunOnWorker();
  - virtual void FinishRunOnWorker();
  The old function calls will be removed in Geant4 VMC version > 5.4

commit.message: Making version 1.1

Export install prefix in CMake package (#18)

Following the [PR #18 in geant4_vmc](vmc-project/geant4_vmc#18)
by Christian Tacke, GSI in all VMC packages

Late geometry construction (#11)

* only construct geometry when first TVirtualMC is registered instead of
  when TVirtualMCApplication is registered

* e.g. possible to change parameters until then

Co-authored-by: Benedikt Volkel <benedikt.volkel@cern.ch>

commit.message:
Comply with TVirtualMCStack::PopNextTrack logic (#9)

Don't rely on the user to the engine to set the current track but do it
when the next track is popped via TVirtualMCStack::PopNextTrack(...)

Co-authored-by: Benedikt Volkel <benedikt.volkel@cern.ch>

commit.message:
Restored the dictionaries relocability, improve security and clean up for packaging

* Make Header Paths in Dictionary Relative

According to

https://root.cern/doc/v618/release-notes.html#header-location-and-root_generate_dictionary-root_standard_library_package

the listed headers in ROOT_GENERATE_DICTIONARY should use
relative paths.

Before this change, the headers are loaded from the
source/build tree. If the source/build tree is removed
after installation, the headers are not found any more.

With this change, the headers in the install tree are found
by the interpreter, when ROOT_INCLUDE_PATH is set.

* Change Include Path List in Dictionary

The generated dictionary used to contain the source/build
tree paths as the search path for include files. This works
for developers, but isn't good for the installed module.
In the worst case, it's a security risk, because the
source/build paths could be abused by an attacker.

So what is this change doing:
1. Append the install path to the search path. This is done
   using the OPTIONS argument to ROOT_GENERATE_DICTIONARY,
   which is appended at the end.
2. This doesn't affect the dictionary generation, because
   all headers should be findable in earlier (sourc/build)
   search path elements.
3. Use "-excludePath" to remove (nearly) all source/build
   path elements from the search path, that is finally
   stored in the dictionary.
4. This way, the install paths are first in the search list
   and all relevant headers should be findable there after
   installing.

Important Note:

For developers this means, that they either have to install
always to use things or use ROOT_INCLUDE_PATH to point to
the source/build tree.
Otherwise they might get outdated headers from the install
tree.

verification.payload:
tree 6f87a0372f0bce039101420beabd96f7ec9144fa
parent b278373f1d635351a34e5b9b4cdcb8f5b1ece591
author Dr. Christian Tacke <58549698+ChristianTackeGSI@users.noreply.github.com> 1587993103 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1587993103 +0200

Restored the dictionaries relocability, improve security and clean up for packaging

* Make Header Paths in Dictionary Relative

According to

https://root.cern/doc/v618/release-notes.html#header-location-and-root_generate_dictionary-root_standard_library_package

the listed headers in ROOT_GENERATE_DICTIONARY should use
relative paths.

Before this change, the headers are loaded from the
source/build tree. If the source/build tree is removed
after installation, the headers are not found any more.

With this change, the headers in the install tree are found
by the interpreter, when ROOT_INCLUDE_PATH is set.

* Change Include Path List in Dictionary

The generated dictionary used to contain the source/build
tree paths as the search path for include files. This works
for developers, but isn't good for the installed module.
In the worst case, it's a security risk, because the
source/build paths could be abused by an attacker.

So what is this change doing:
1. Append the install path to the search path. This is done
   using the OPTIONS argument to ROOT_GENERATE_DICTIONARY,
   which is appended at the end.
2. This doesn't affect the dictionary generation, because
   all headers should be findable in earlier (sourc/build)
   search path elements.
3. Use "-excludePath" to remove (nearly) all source/build
   path elements from the search path, that is finally
   stored in the dictionary.
4. This way, the install paths are first in the search list
   and all relevant headers should be findable there after
   installing.

Important Note:

For developers this means, that they either have to install
always to use things or use ROOT_INCLUDE_PATH to point to
the source/build tree.
Otherwise they might get outdated headers from the install
tree.

commit.message: Fixed generation of root dictionary map
Making version 1.0
Removed warning about a development version from README and clean-up

Updated documentation:
- Link documentation from vmc-project instead of ROOT
- Removed README.multiple.md (now available in documentation)

Added printing of the version number in TVirtualMC constructor
and the TMCVersion.h header with the version definitions.

Fix in TGeoMCGeometry::Mixture(Int_t& kmat, const char* name, Float_t……* ...):

'wmat' values were not updated when the function is called with nlmat<0, as they
should be to mimic the Geant3 behavior.
It corresponds to 87037f5 commit in root-project/root.

Make TMCParticleStatus.h identical with the file in ROOT:

This applies a fix in Info scope() and reverts changes in the class description which diverged.

Details:
Fix from Root (3e2cb48):
Re-apply: Disambiguate ROOT's ::Info from Pythia8's Info:

Some Pythia8 headers expose an unfortunate "using namespace Pythia8".
This triggers:
In file included from /root/ship-log-keep/sw/slc7_x86-64/ROOT/master_FAIRSHIP-1/include/TMCManager.h:26:
/root/ship-log-keep/sw/slc7_x86-64/ROOT/master_FAIRSHIP-1/include/TMCParticleStatus.h:81:7: error: reference to 'Info' is ambiguous
      Info("Print", "Status of track");
      ^
/root/ship-log-keep/sw/BUILD/b61305e07edfb1f9a906335e2093ac409db3c4cc/ROOT/include/TError.h:58:13: note: candidate found by name lookup is 'Info'
extern void Info(const char *location, const char *msgfmt, ...)
            ^
/root/ship-log-keep/sw/slc7_x86-64/pythia/v8230-ship-1/include/Pythia8/Info.h:30:7: note: candidate found by name lookup is 'Pythia8::Info'
class Info {
      ^

By explicitly requesting "::Info" that ambiguity should be resolved.

Upgrade CMake (#7)

* Upgrade CMake

- Find ROOT always by its CMake config, added Geom EG in required components
- Make the VMC relocatable:
  - Avoid hard-coded library paths in the VMCLibrary target:
    - Added the list of selected ROOT libraries which we depend on (ROOT_DEPS)
    - Linking the library only against this list instead of ${ROOT_LIBRARIES} 
      and added this list in the target interface properties
  - Added target_include_directories
Reactivated doxygen deployement for master branch
Deploy Doxygen only for tags

Withdraw unwanted TMCVerbose modifications to avoid changes in the tests outputs:
- the modifs were introduced with the PR#3

Added script and configuration files for clang-format: (#5)

- Besides the default .clang-format file, there are also added the .clang-format.root and .clang-format.g4vmc files; the default = .clang-format.root
- Only files which are olready formetted will be processed by the script to avid a divergence with the vmc in ROOT

parent 760437c05c90924506daf21244762de5bbbdf5ab
author Ivana Hrivnacova <Ivana.Hrivnacova@cern.ch> 1564758957 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1564758957 +0200

Added script and configuration files for clang-format: (#5)

- Besides the default .clang-format file, there are also added the .clang-format.root and .clang-format.g4vmc files; the default = .clang-format.root
- Only files which are olready formetted will be processed by the script to avid a divergence with the vmc in ROOT
